topic.title: First Start-Up of the UPS System

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: First Start-Up of the UPS System

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Task instructions for initial power-up and commissioning of the UPS system, including pre-start checks and verification steps.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: Hazard or electric shock, explosion, or arc flash

sl.sli: Follow the Schneider Electric safety procedures (SE425 and SE460)
Check the input phase rotation (L1–L2–L3 clockwise)

ul.li: For a REPO with internal supply: Remove the jumper from the EPO terminals J1602 between pin 3 and 4 on the external connection board 0P2553 (A811).
For a REPO with external supply: Activate the REPO switch.

li.stepxmp: This enables crosschecking via the display on first start-up because the system state can be completely OFF while the display is ON.

li.p: Close UIB to turn on the UPS.
li.stepresult: Now that the EPO jumper is open and the mains input breaker UIB is closed, the PFC will not start and the system is supplied by the passive rectifier.

li.p: Connect your PC to the UPS, launch Tuner, and connect to the display module — follow the instructions in .
li.stepxmp:
For units built after July 2018 (without transformer), the display will show Waiting for controllers.
Waiting for controllersPlease wait...
If the display shows this message, follow steps a and b below. If the display does not show this message, continue with step 4.

li.p: Change setting 048 from 500 to 208 via the UPS Tuner.
Open UIB, wait 30 seconds and then close UIB.
li.stepresult: The unit should now be in Standby mode.

li.p: From the Main Menu, select Diagnosis using the UP/DOWN keys and the ENTER key and check the U DC bus. See for more information. The DC bus voltages must be about 300 VDC. (+) and (–) may not be completely balanced.
li.stepresult: If there is already a big load on the DC bus this rectifier will not be able to charge the DC bus to an acceptable voltage. If the DC bus voltages are correct, please proceed to the next step.

li.p: If an input transformer is installed:
From the Main Menu, select System status using the UP/DOWN keys and the ENTER key and check the measured input voltage before the transformer. See for more information.
From the Main Menu, select Diagnosis using the UP/DOWN keys and the ENTER key and check the measured input voltage after the transformer.

li.stepresult: If the input voltages are correct, you can proceed.

li.p: If a bypass transformer is installed:
From the Main Menu, select System status using the UP/DOWN keys and the ENTER key and check the measured bypass voltage before the transformer.
From the Main Menu, select Diagnosis using the UP/DOWN keys and the ENTER key and check the measured bypass voltage after the transformer.

li.stepresult: If the bypass voltages are correct, you can proceed.

li.p: If the HMI has been replaced, load the settings sheet to the new HMI: Download the default settings file for the UPS from ServiceView. See how to import the settings file or change the settings manually in .
Set the following settings for UPS systems with battery cabinet — find the relevant settings in ServiceView for the specific battery configuration.

table.title: Settings to Configure for UPS Systems with Battery Cabinet

entry.p: Cyclic charge time on in hours
Cyclic charge repeat cycle in days

li.p: Check/adjust the following settings if the HMI has been replaced.These settings are set in the factory, but will be lost if the HMI is replaced.

table.title: Settings for 25–50 kVA UPS Systems with Input Transformer (Single Mains)
Settings for 75–100 kVA UPS Systems with Input Transformer (Single Mains) and 25–100 kVA Systems with Input and Bypass Transformers (Dual Mains)
Settings for 25–100 kVA UPS Systems with 480/600V Input/Bypass Transformers

li.p: Press Send to implement the settings.
Turn unit input breaker UIB to the OFF position.
Turn static switch input breaker SSIB to the OFF position.
Wait 30 seconds.
Turn unit input breaker UIB to the ON position and wait for the UPS to turn on.
Verify that the settings have been changed in Tuner.
If the DC bus voltage cannot be read out or if it differs drastically from the above-mentioned value, check the troubleshooting table below. Otherwise, please proceed to the next step.

row.entry: Check the supply wiring. The controller is supplied by the PM. The upper power module is connected to the upper right connector on the CBOX (24V/15V with positive upper pin). The display is then connected to the uppermost controller on top right side. The Interface is then connected to the lowermost controller on the bottom right side. All controllers must be connected from the top to the bottom controller by connecting the bottom right connector of the upper controller with the top right connector of the lower one.
Text No valid system configuration file available
Please retry to download the system setting sheet.
Text Waiting for controllers or System configuration setup please wait…

If this text is indicated the display gets no ok by the master controller. This can happen if the configuration is downloaded correctly but the controller is not compatible with the display. The same text appears if the self-test fails. Please check the self-test state in the service port directly on the controller in the RAW status menu.

Check the Abus wiring and if all terminators are located correctly. This means the display is the first Abus member with built in terminator then all controllers are connected together and at the end the interface is connected. If no relay board is available the terminator is located on the interface, else the relay board is connected to the interface and the terminator is located on the relay board.

li.p: Open the unit input breaker UIB.

ul.li: For a REPO with internal supply: Reconnect the jumper on the EPO terminals J1602 between pin 3 and 4 on the external connection board 0P2553 (A811).
For a REPO with external supply: Deactivate the REPO switch.

li.p: Close the unit input breaker UIB.
Close the static switch input breaker SSIB.
li.stepresult:
Wait for Logic to boot and display to normalize.
Check LED lights on Controllers to verify that all are on and working and that only 1 is saying it is the master.The PFC starts to work. The closing of the input contactor can be heard. If everything is ok the contactor stays closed. A DC-bus voltage of about +/- 225V can be read out in the diagnosis menu.
U dc-bus: + 225.0V -225.0V
The mimic diagram is now displaying the correct switch position:
If something is wrong the input contactor is opened after a short time. Check if input phases are available and within tolerance.

li.p: Check the indications. A missing input phase or a wrong input range can be checked very easily.
Check input and bypass voltages, , see and .
Check the indication of the unit input breaker UIB, the battery breaker BB and the static switch input breaker SSIB. Check if input and bypass are within tolerance.

li.stepresult: If all values are ok, please proceed to the next step.

li.p: Press the ON button on the display to turn on the UPS.
li.stepresult: Do not close the battery breaker(s) BB! Now the inverter only is turned on. If everything is ok, check the measurements and the indication on the display.

li.p: Before connecting the battery please check the polarity of the battery voltage. The battery voltage can be measured on the battery breaker BB, see and . If the polarity is correct, connect the battery. Please check the measurements and the indication on the display.
Check output frequency. If the output frequency is about 60 Hz you will be able to go into bypass operation via the display. Transfer the load to static bypass:
From the Main Menu, select System Control Bypass Control using the UP/DOWN keys and the ENTER key.

entry.screen: Confirm action:UPS into Bypass NO, Abort►YES, UPS into Bypass

li.p: Select YES, UPS into Bypass to transfer to requested static bypass operation. The following message will appear on the display:

entry.screen: The load is supplied via the static bypass switch

li.stepresult: If the transfer to static bypass was successful, please proceed to the next step.

li.p: Transfer the UPS back to normal operation:
From the Main Menu, select System Control Bypass Control using the UP/DOWN keys and the ENTER key.
Select YES, UPS out of Bypass to transfer to normal operation.

entry.screen: Confirm action:UPS out of Bypass NO, Abort►YES, UPS out of Bypass

li.stepresult: If the transfer was successful, please proceed to the next step to calibrate the UPS system. See on how to access the system settings via Tuner.

li.p: Calibrate the voltage settings.If the displayed voltage is higher than the actual voltage – decrease the value in the corresponding calibration setting. If the displayed voltage is lower than the actual voltage – increase the value in the corresponding calibration setting.

Calibrate the current settings.If the displayed current is higher than the actual current – decrease the value in the corresponding calibration setting. If the displayed current is lower than the actual current – increase the value in the corresponding calibration setting.
Verify that the life cycle monitoring (LCM) is activated, see for setting up the LCM.

If necessary, the controller firmware must be upgraded. The actual firmware can be read out in the diagnosis menu. Note that if there is a system with a power rating > 25 kVA all controllers must be updated. See , , , , and for instructions on updating firmware.
